instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00850 water damage fan work but dead
threads.message:
Test the board alone on the desk; it should start when charger is connected (no battery present).
Use an USB macOS pendrive with Link LED, to check for USB activity (if is the case).
Check voltage (at least pulse) at all big coils, in the first seconds.

o.k the loop problem is when i connect the  Battery Daughter Board Cable.
when its off its show 19v.
there is NO usb activity.

threads.title: 820-00850 water damage fan work but dead
threads.message:
I mentioned fan spin as you said does it for 1s; so voltages should appear, at least pulse that time.
No need to connect fan, nor other thing; just check voltage in that time you know fan was spinning.
Fan requires 5V to spin, other voltages try to appear at least?

NO.
Check if you get some voltages obly with charger; or pulse at least, on big coils.

threads.title: 820-00850 water damage fan work but dead
threads.message:
Not always (very) low ohm value is short.
Please, try to understand the difference.

CPU coils have very low values normally; however, not bellow 1 ohm.
Compare with similar CPU.

PPBUS_G3H looping???

update:
i was disable the short on P5VUSB...but still  L7030 (CHGR_LX1/2) looping from 1v to 12v  and PPBUS_G3H IS 12.2V stable

[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 63802, member: 682"]
CPU coils have very low values normally; however, not bellow 1 ohm.

threads.title: 820-00850 water damage fan work but dead
threads.message:
Why do you bother with L7030???
It is not directly connected to PPBUS_G3H like in old boards.
If PPBUS_G3H is stable, there is no problem on U7000 area.
The problem is that SMC (inside T2) does NOT properly communicate with U7000.

threads.message:

[/QUOTE]
i just sew that its loop so....
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 63806, member: 682"]
The problem is that SMC (inside T2) does NOT properly communicate with U7000.
[/QUOTE]
how can i find the bad communication? do i need to replace the SMC?

threads.title: 820-00850 water damage fan work but dead
threads.message:
You cannot replace SMC; it is part of T2 now.

I suppose board still has problems caused by corrosion.
This could be the reason is not listed on the other MacBook for DFU restore.

Or i need to give up?

threads.title: 820-00850 water damage fan work but dead
threads.message:
Could be just one corroded resistor, or accumulated crap under some BGA chip.
Is not an easy case; may be waste of time...

threads.title: 820-00850 water damage fan work but dead
threads.message:
Do not check DC voltage on L7030.
It is not directly connected with PPBUS_G3H; didn't see Q7040?
And STOP to check Gate MOSFETs for voltage, is irrelevant.

threads.title: 820-00850 water damage fan work but dead
threads.message:
The heat applied to the board changed the behaviour.
Something else reacted at heat.
There should be more things affected by corrosion.
Try heating BGA chips with quality flux and pass to board trough ultrasonic cleaner at the end.

threads.title: 820-00850 water damage fan work but dead
threads.message: there is no BGA chip near to it...but ill keep looking for corrosion...and enter the board to ultrasonic..
